New Records: Nikola Jokic and Russell Westbrook are the first pair of teammates to record 25-point triple-doubles in the same regular-season game in NBA history.
Key Match Events: The Nuggets conquered their fears with a 124-105 win at Ball Arena, but they kept coach Michael Malone on the edge of his seat most of the night.
The score was suddenly 97-92 early in the fourth quarter.
Jokic amassed 35 points, 12 rebounds, 15 assists and four steals in his return to the lineup.
Russell Westbrook matched the defending MVP's triple-double for the second time this season with 25 points, 11 rebounds and 10 assists.
Pre-Game Insights: Michael Malone might never get over his phobia of short-handed draft lottery teams.
The Brooklyn Nets’ injury report had to be nightmare fuel for him.
No Cameron Johnson, D’Angelo Russell, Cam Thomas, De’Anthony Melton, Bojan Bogdanovic or Trendon Watford.
And the Nuggets were getting MVP center Nikola Jokic back after two games of sick leave.
Post-Match Reflections: Malone went to Jalen Pickett for rotation minutes to combat foul trouble in the first half, with Christian Braun particularly endangered by three whistles.
After the break, Pickett was needed again as Jamal Murray felt soreness in his left knee and didn’t return.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets (22-15) played with their food but stretched.
They got to the line for 33 free throw attempts in the win.
Keon Johnson led the Nets with 22 points.
Tyrese Martin added 19 off the bench for a ragtag team that finished with seven double-digit scorers.
